intro: Ceropegia megasepala, commonly known as the giant African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and large, waxy leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. The plant produces striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. Ceropegia megasepala is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
